column2: OR DRIVERS LICENSE TEST
column4: Oregon
column6: OR

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. It's 10 AM. This sign tells you that:
column4: you are allowed to park until 5:30 PM.
column6: you are not allowed to park here.
column8: you must park your car between 8:30 AM and 5:30 PM.
column10: you must display a special permit in order to park here.

column2: 2. This road sign means:
column4: Stop ahead
column6: Tow away zone
column8: Buggy warning

column2: 3. When you approach this sign, you must:
column4: watch for workers crossing the road.
column6: go to work.
column8: stop if necessary.

column2: 4. Drive below the posted speed limit when:
column4: others drive below the speed limit.
column6: anything makes conditions less than perfect.
column8: entering a highway where there are other cars.
column10: you are on a four lane road.

column2: 5. To reduce their chances of colliding with an animal, drivers should:
column4: scan the sides of the road to watch for the reflection of vehicle headlights in the eyes of animals.
column6: look well down the road and far off to each side.
column8: Slow down when approaching animals that are standing near the road.

column2: 6. What should you do when another car is trying to pass you?
column4: After checking for oncoming traffic, adjust your speed to allow safe passing.
column6: speed up.
column8: pull off the road to allow safe passing.
column10: yield the right-of-way to the other driver.

column2: 7. The sign in the picture:
column4: is displayed on the rear of slow moving vehicles.
column6: is a Construction and Maintenance Traffic Control sign.
column8: is found at most intersections and indicates that drivers must yield to other vehicles.
column10: means that you need to stop.

column2: 8. Aggressive driving includes:
column4: All of the above.
column6: yelling, honking, gesturing at other drivers.
column8: quick lane changes without a signal.

column2: 9. Anything that requires you to _______ could cause you to crash.
column4: take your eyes off the road
column6: take your attention away from driving
column8: take your hands off the wheel

column2: 10. Drivers can not pass a vehicle on the left if:
column4: they are within 100 feet of a railroad crossing on a two-way roadway.
column6: they can not safely return to the right lane before they reach a solid yellow center line for the right lane.
column8: they approach the top of a hill on a two-way road and can not see over it.

column2: 11. This traffic sign warns you about:
column4: an intersection ahead.
column6: a hill or a downgrade up ahead on the road.
column8: a winding road.

column2: 12. When approaching someone using a white cane, you should proceed with caution because:
column4: the pedestrian is blind.
column6: the pedestrian might be using a guide dog.
column8: the pedestrian might be blind.

column2: 13. This road sign means:
column4: Hospital parking ahead
column6: Crossroad
column8: Merge

column2: 14. If you are driving on a road that ends at a “T” intersection with no signs or signals:
column4: all traffic must stop and the driver who stopped first has the right-of-way.
column6: you must yield to drivers on the road that ends at the T intersection.
column8: you must yield to drivers on the through road.
column10: all traffic must stop and the driver on the right has the right-of-way.

column2: 15. Which shape is a warning sign?
column4: Diamond
column6: Pennant
column8: Round

column2: 16. When other drivers around you are acting in anger, you should:
column4: slow down or move over safely.
column6: avoid making eye contact.
column8: distance yourself from the situation.

column2: 17. This sign tells drivers that:
column4: there is a reduction of lanes ahead.
column6: there is a right turn ahead.
column8: a divided highway ends ahead.
column10: they must stay on the right side of the divider

column2: 18. A speed limit is the __________ speed at which a vehicle may legally travel on the road under ideal conditions.
column4: maximum
column6: suggested
column8: minimum

column2: 19. What is the slow moving vehicle symbol?
column4: A reflective orange triangle
column6: A reflective white triangle
column8: A reflective red square

column2: 20. If your car starts to skid, turn your steering wheel:
column4: to keep the front wheels straight.
column6: in the opposite direction of the skid.
column8: in the direction you want to go.
column10: in any direction. It doesnt matter.

column2: 21. This sign means:
column4: U-turns are not allowed.
column6: Parking is not allowed.
column8: No parking on pavement.

column2: 22. If you get on a wrong expressway exit, you must:
column4: make a U-turn and return to the expressway.
column6: drive in reverse to return to the expressway.
column8: get off at the next exit and look for signs that tell you how to return to the expressway.
column10: use the the exit ramp to accelerate to expressway speed and blend with traffic.

column2: 23. A large vehicle is backing up to unload goods. You should:
column4: try to pass close behind.
column6: enter one of the blind spots and wait.
column8: be patient and wait until the large vehicle has completed its backup maneuver.

column2: 24. A flashing red light means:
column4: Go, but yield the right-of-way to other traffic at the intersection.
column6: The light will soon change to steady red.
column8: The same as a STOP sign.

column2: 25. Drivers are required to stop:
column4: when a traffic officer orders them to stop.
column6: where there is a red light.
column8: at an intersection with a stop sign.

column2: 26. This road sign means:
column4: Sharp left turns ahead, in both directions.
column6: The center lane is shared for left turns in both directions of travel.
column8: Vehicles may only travel in the center lane.
column10: The center lane in both directions of travel will soon turn left.

column2: 27. This sign indicates:
column4: Do not use your phone while driving
column6: Phone service ahead
column8: Emergency line available

column2: 28. When you see an emergency vehicle with flashing lights, you must:
column4: slow down and keep moving in your lane.
column6: stop exactly where you are.
column8: pull to the curb and stop.
column10: speed up and take the nearest exit.

column2: 29. This road sign means:
column4: Merge
column6: Persons with Disabilities Parking
column8: Winding Road Ahead
column10: Keep right, traffic is entering from another road.

column2: 30. When passing other vehicles, drivers should:
column4: apply the brake and slow down.
column6: make sure the passing lane is clear of traffic, and check behind and to the left to make sure another vehicle is not attempting to pass.
column8: pass the vehicle as slowly as possible.

column2: 31. Two solid yellow lines on the pavement mean:
column4: passing is allowed during daylight only.
column6: passing is allowed if you are at the top of a hill.
column8: passing is allowed for both drivers.

column2: 32. You should increase your following distance when:
column4: exiting a freeway.
column6: driving behind a large vehicle that blocks your vision.
column8: following a motorcycle.

column2: 33. This sign warns drivers that:
column4: U-turns are now allowed.
column6: they cannot go straight ahead.
column8: they will soon be facing oncoming traffic.

column2: 34. Which shape is a railroad advance warning sign?
column4: Rectangle
column6: Crossbuck
column8: Pentagon

column2: 35. Drivers may continue carefully through a yellow light if:
column4: there are no pedestrians crossing.
column6: they are turning right.
column8: an emergency vehicle is crossing your lane.
column10: they already are within the intersection.
